summary: The Federal Advisory Committee Database Act amends Title 5 of the United States Code to improve the management and transparency of federal advisory committees. It tasks the Administrator of General Services with collecting and publishing comprehensive information on these committees, including their members, activities, and costs. The bill mandates agencies to provide this information and establishes guidelines for standardizing reporting. It also requires the Administrator to report biennially to Congress and emphasizes the role of Agency heads in managing these committees, ensuring compliance, and establishing performance measures. The bill specifies that no additional funds are authorized.
